God of WisdomUpdated on 07 Jun 2019Hey Anon, SSBs yields are a little low and coupons are paid out bi-annually. If you're looking for some regular passive income, you may want to consider high yield dividend paying funds. I suggest looking at some High Yield Corporate Bond funds. Dividends of 6-7% are quite common. They pay monthly, and are less risky than investing in equities as well.2 comments2
